intro: Calonyction proximum, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has slender stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds.
